conclusion: To determine the trend of the acceleration of object B during the time interval 0 to t2, we need to analyze its velocity-time graph.
The graph shows the velocity (v) of two objects (A and B) as a function of time (t).
Both objects start at the same point on the time axis, indicating that they begin their motion at the same moment.
At t = 0, both objects have positive velocities.
As time progresses up to t = t1, object B's velocity decreases while object A's velocity increases.

premise: Object B's velocity decreases up to t = t1.
conclusion: Object B has a negative acceleration at this stage (decreasing velocity).
At t = t1, the velocity of object B reaches zero.
After t = t1, both objects continue to move, but their velocities start to change direction (object B starts moving in the opposite direction while object A continues in the same direction).
Between t1 and t2, object B's velocity increases from zero back to a positive value.
During this period, the slope of the velocity-time graph for object B becomes steeper, indicating an increase in velocity over time.

premise: The slope of the velocity-time graph represents the acceleration.
conclusion: Since the velocity of object B is increasing over the time interval t1 to t2, the slope of the tangent line to the curve at any point in this interval is positive.

premise: The slope of the tangent line to the curve is positive between t1 and t2.
conclusion: Therefore, the acceleration of object B is positive between t1 and t2.

premise: The analysis of the velocity-time graph.
conclusion: The trend of the acceleration of object B during the time interval 0 to t2 is positive.
